page.title: 13The Garage: FINTRY
page.content:
The presence of a garage in a small rural community with little public transport is vital, yet its survival depends on its ability to diversify.
Petrol sales are equally divided between local and passing trade, 70,000 gallons being sold annually. Servicing and repair work is also split between local and other clients.
A mini-bus is contracted to take children from the outlying farms and houses to Fintry and Balfron Schools.
Lastly Post Office work. Collection, sorting and delivery. A 7 hour task over 45 miles, which can take a long time in heavy winter snow!
